etymology.description: 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") + 戲(戲) (xì, "play") = ceremonial cloth bundled for trade or offerings -> currency
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 幣 (bì, "currency") is composed of 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth") suggesting textiles, a common trade item, combined with 戲(戲) (xì, "play") originally meaning a bundle or a certain wrapping. This reflects the original use of cloth for barter or ceremonial exchanges, thus developing the meaning of 'currency'.
etymology.simplification: 币(幣): The character 敝(幣) (bì, "tattered") was simplified by replacing the lower component 戲 (xì, "play") with a single stroke 丿, simplifying the form significantly while retaining the top 巾(巾) (jīn, "cloth").

examples.chinese: 比特币(比特幣)价格波动大(價格波動大)。
在国际市场上(在國際市場上)，电子币(電子幣)交易频繁(交易頻繁)。
examples.pinyin: Zài guójì shìchǎng shàng, diànzǐ bì jiāoyì pínfán.
examples.english: On the international market, digital currency transactions occur frequently.

examples.chinese: 古代时(古代時)，实物币(實物幣)为贸易提供便利(為貿易提供便利)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài shí, shíwù bì wèi màoyì tígōng biànlì.
examples.english: In ancient times, commodity currency provided convenience for trade.
